page.title: 09ARMED FORCES 1
page.content: The first Royal Air Force Station in Hullavington was No 9 Flying Training School in 1937.The construction of a concrete runway began in the early 1940's. R.A.F Hullavington became the home of the Empire Central Flying School until it was disbanded in July 1949. R.A.F Hullavington is cammanded by a Group Captain and consists of one Regt. Wing, 4 Squadrons and the Defence Codification Data Centre. Special units are the HQ No 5 Wing R.A.F Regt.,The Nos II & 15 Sqn.R.A.F Regt ,the Operations Sqn., Engineering Sqn., Supply Sqn., Administrative Sqn., Mobile Catering Support Unit and Defence Codification Data Centre (DC.DC). Hullavington is a dropping zone so Operations Sqn. continues to fly balloons for parachute training.
